channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Signals heads have rotated., 31st July
item.description:
Whilst waiting at the stop line on the A40 at Arle Court roundabout toward Cheltenham both the lights for A40 and those for travelling around the roundabout are visible. It looks like both signal heads have rotated out of position slightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Court Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Unfinished panting of yellow lines, 31st July
item.description:
Sheldons Court, Winchcombe Street, Cheltenham Yellow lines should have continued to the gates and around the statue which is where the faded lines go to but they stopped at the speed bump at the entrance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheldons Court, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Path erosion, 31st July
item.description:
Location shown in photo attached. It's along the path across the fields joining the 2 flood defences / reservoirs from Prestbury towards Slad Way and on towards Battledown. It's at the specific point of the bridge over the stream, there's a lot of path erosion where dogs run out. There's so much now that roots are exposed and there are trip hazards near deepish water where it pools. The path is becoming narrower and the sooner it is bolstered the less the cost will be to repair it, which will eventually have to happen. It's inevitable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bouncers Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Roadworks on Pavement, 31st July
item.description:
Gloucester Road (B4633) - on pavement by St Marks Methodist Chapel. You have closed my previous report (7511420) stating that my enquiry has been 'addressed'. This is disingenuous by GCC Highways. Three months after having reported this issue (via Fix My Street) I had to involve my GCC Councillor to find out why this obstruction continued to be in place. My councillor (not GCC Highways) informed me that the obstruction is due to Virgin Media (VM) infrastructure causing a trip hazard and GCC Highway's inability to get VM to fix their infrastructure. I will not consider this report to be 'addressed' until VM have fixed their infrastructure and this obstruction removed. Please DO NOT close this report until this is the case.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-8, Stow Court, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Giant hogweed plant in flower, 30th July
item.description:
There is a single giant hogweed plant growing in the verge on the left hand side of the road if you’re heading towards Churchdown. We spotted it when out running along the road on 19th July but have only just remembered to report it. The plant is not the tallest I’ve ever seen, but it is definitely the giant hogweed variety as it has a huge thick stem and enormous flower umbels. It is growing towards the back of the verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 30th July
item.description:
Customer reports that a tree opposite 60 Albert Road has a large dead branch hanging in the road, whilst another directly outside of 60 Albert Road has a dead branch which could potentially fall on the footway. Please can Highways remove these to make the trees safe.
Report on FixMyStreet
